meanings.definition: The quality or state of being black.
meanings.sent1: The blacknesses of the night sky were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with an eerie blacknesses.
meanings.sent3: The blacknesses of the burnt toast made it look like charcoal.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was shrouded in the blacknesses of grief.
meanings.sent5: The blacknesses of the cave enveloped them in a cloak of darkness.

meanings.definition: The darkness or absence of light.
meanings.sent1: The blacknesses of the room made it impossible to see.
meanings.sent2: The blacknesses of the forest at night were unsettling.
meanings.sent3: The blacknesses of the movie theater made it perfect for a horror film.
meanings.sent4: In the blacknesses of the tunnel, they could only rely on their sense of touch.
meanings.sent5: The blacknesses of the storm clouds signaled an impending downpour.

meanings.definition: The condition of being of the darkest color.
meanings.sent1: The blacknesses of the cat's fur made it blend into the night.
meanings.sent2: The blacknesses of the ink made the words on the page stark and bold.
meanings.sent3: The blacknesses of the coffee indicated it was a strong brew.
meanings.sent4: The blacknesses of the night sky were punctuated by twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The blacknesses of the shadow seemed to swallow everything in its path.
